name: Vietnamese Manufacturing Facility Shutdown - Typhoon Saola

timeline.event: Typhoon hits Vietnam - Supplier shutdown begins
All warehouses depleted - Peak stockout begins

explainability.calculation:
Current Stock: 45,000 units
Daily Demand: 1,200 units/day
In-transit: 8,500 units (Day 12)
Extended supply: (45,000 + 8,500) / 1,200 = 44.6 days
Disrupted resupply: 45 days + 21 days = 66 days
Stockout period: 66 - 44.6 = 21.4 days
Units short: 1,200 × 21.4 = 25,680 units
Revenue impact: 25,680 × $2.50 = $64,200
explainability.whyMatters: Amoxicillin is a sole-source SKU (100% from this supplier). No alternative supplier in network. Critical antibiotic with consistent demand.
explainability.dataSource: Historical demand (90-day average): 1,200 units/day. Demand volatility: ±5% (low). Safety stock target: 18,000 units (15 days).

explainability.calculation:
Current Stock: 78,000 units
Daily Demand: 2,500 units/day
In-transit: 12,000 units (Day 12)
Extended supply: (78,000 + 12,000) / 2,500 = 36 days
Stockout period: 66 - 36 = 30 days
Units short: 2,500 × 30 = 75,000 units
explainability.whyMatters: 60% of supply from this supplier. Alternative suppliers exist but capacity limited.
explainability.dataSource: Historical demand shows 2,500 units/day average with ±8% volatility.

explainability.calculation:
Current Stock: 32,000 units
Daily Demand: 900 units/day
Extended supply: (32,000 + 6,500) / 900 = 42.8 days
Stockout period: 66 - 42.8 = 23.2 days
Units short: 900 × 23.2 = 20,880 units
explainability.whyMatters: Critical diabetes medication with zero substitute availability. Patient health risk if stockout occurs.
explainability.dataSource: Steady demand pattern, low volatility (±3%). 12-month average: 900 units/day.

explainability.whyHighestRisk:
WH-West runs out first due to:
- Higher demand density (98 stores vs 62 in Atlanta)
- Faster inventory turnover rate
- Received smaller allocation in last replenishment (12k vs 15k in Newark)

Affected stores include 15 hospital pharmacies (critical accounts).

explainability.whyMostAffected:
Hospital pharmacy = high-volume, critical care.
Serves 2,300 patients monthly across 8 affected SKUs.
Higher unit prices due to hospital contracts.
Zero tolerance for stockouts (patient safety).

Patient care implications:
- 600 patients need Amoxicillin prescriptions filled elsewhere
- Average patient travel to alternative pharmacy: 4.2 miles
- Regulatory risk: Hospital must report medication shortages to FDA

assumptions.justification: Pharma demand is relatively stable (±5% variance)
Current network has no backup for 8/12 SKUs

revenueImpact.label: Medium
revenueImpact.reason: Depends on customer behavior during stockout

patientImpact.label: Medium
patientImpact.reason: Estimates based on prescription fill rates
